data.title: Nice restaurant, but.....
data.text: Nice intimate restaurant with a great bar area. Great calamari and shrimp for apps; knowledgeable waiter who assisted us with wine selection. Downsides: our table was right in front of the restroom--didn't enjoy seeing the toilet whenever a patron opened the door. Also, my husband's veal dish was over cooked and parking is very limited.

data.title: Tutto va bene at Tutto (All is good at Tutto)
data.text:
My wife and I ate at Tutto with modest expectations and were ecstatic to discover an Italian gem in the making. She had the shrimp risotto and had the nerve to say  it was as good as my homemade version of that exquisite dish, but she was right. I had the fish and fagioli (Tuscan beans) and compared it to one I had in Tuscany. Serving size was large enough to take some home for a Tutto deja vu. Restaurant atmosphere was cozy and quiet. Staff pleasant and eager to please. And they tossed in a free cannoli. What else could we ask for? Only a return visit. Gracie Tutto! 

S

data.title: Very nice dinner, great owner
data.text:
My wife and I were walking through Historic Roswell during Alive in Roswell and chose Tutto to stop at for dinner. Anna our server was great and took care of everything we needed. My wife enjoyed the beet salad and I had the the shrimp and polenta with a littleneck clam appetizer. The clams were very tasty and I appreciated Anna giving me the option to moderate the spiciness. I found the shrimp a little dry but good. Something that stood out was the owner's personalized attention. Miriam encouraged us to try the tiramisu which she makes net time. I enjoyed the creme broil for desert. 

I would pick a different table if I were ever to visit again during Alive. It seems that Tutto is generous enough to allow non-customers to use the facilities which resulted in a constant stream of (mostly) women walking back and forth behind me since we were seated between the front door and the bathroom.

data.title: Great Meal
data.text: Had a really nice meal here with friends.  A bit quiet but it was a Wednesday evening.  The shrimp risotto was delish, as was the lamb shank and veal.

data.title: Great Restaurant
data.text: My family took me here for a birthday celebration, what a surprise! The food was delicious and the service was outstanding. They could not have been more accomadating. The Scallops served on top of White Truffle Risotto was over the top.

data.title: Parking: The Least of Your Problems
data.text:
Went with friends on a week night. There's one handicapped parking spot and fortunately it was empty. How far should a handicapped person (my guest) walk in a little town with many good restaurants and such limited parking? This problem discourages me from going downtown Roswell as much as I would like.
Inside, the dimly lighted restaurant is sparse but clean. The space is small, so tables are close together. When someone needs to get up, everyone must move, like in a movie theatre, but not quite as spacious. My overall impression of the food at Tutto Kitchen & Bar was too much variance in menu choices and in taste of the end product. The mussels were just okay, so smothered in chopped garlic that I tasted it for two days afterwards. My paella, (more garlic) which fortunately I shared, was a huge portion, very rich and delicious. The octopus appetizer was a big hit, the shrimp in polenta lacked any flavor, and the other dishes were just okay, but two, proclaimed as Italian, were returned as unsatisfactory. The service is pleasant, helpful, and slow, mainly because there was only one waiter. True, the restaurant is small, but they were not very busy. They are pricy, however. Pricy is okay if they would live up to the menu promises. It did not happen for us.

data.title: Excellent   Addition to Canton St Area
data.text: Tutto's was a 1st time for the four of us, and it was excellent. This is a small neighborhood type Italian restaurant. The menu, excellent wine list and full bar were a hit right from the get go. The fried Risotto Balls w/ Red Sauce and Caesar Salad were super starters as were the Seared Diver Scallops and Lasagna (vegetarian or w/short rib) for dinner and the cannoli to finish off a delightful evening. The presentation was superb as was the wait staff. Steve and Job were right on  and very knowledgeable about   menu favorites and the extensive wine list.  Reservations are necessary at most times. Highly Recommended.

data.title: I absolutely love this place
data.text: EVERYTHING I've had at Tutto has been amazing, but my favorite thing on the menu is the shrimp risotto-- OMG, it's SO amazing!!! Always great service, as well!

data.title: No Parking, be prepared to drive around
data.text:
The server was pleasant and the food was good however, there is no parking for the restaurant.  They have a 4 page website but there in no mention of off site parking.  We drove around for almost an hour looking for a space and finally parked in a lot 4 blocks away.  This is not something you expect in Roswell and we were not prepared for it.  

Was the experience worth $5 parking and a 4 block walk in over 90 degree heat, NO.

data.title: Excellent Service! Friendly, welcoming restaurant with good food
data.text:
This past Sunday I ate at Tutto for the second time and I had a lovely experience. I called earlier in the day to make a reservation and the general manager answered and asked me if it was a special occasion. I mentioned my brother and I were taking my father out for a belated Father’s day celebration and he said no problem, we’ll have your table ready. When we walked in the door, he greeted us by name and had a Father’s Day card waiting for us on the table that he had printed out and had the staff sign. It was such a kind gesture and made my dad feel very special. Our waitress was excellent, she is normally the bartender but told us she waits tables on Sundays and she recommended a really nice cabernet that we enjoyed. We started with the fried goat cheese and it was served over arugula with a honey drizzle. I don’t think you can go wrong with fried goat cheese and this was excellent. I especially loved the arugula with honey, it was very tasty and I think with a touch of balsamic vinegar it would be perfect. We also shared the Beef short rib ragu over fontina polenta cakes. This was good but not great. It lacked a little flavor in my opinion, but everyone at the table seemed to enjoy it. I could not taste the fontina and the polenta seemed bland to me but I would give this another try.
For the main course two people in our party got the special of the day which was a salmon dish with farfalle pasta and a cream sauce. Both said they enjoyed the dish, it was a big portion and very rich but delicious. Can you go wrong with cream sauce? I think not. My dad got the Sausage and Pepper Fettuccini with bell peppers and onions. Two things to know about my dad besides the fact that he’s awesome. He is an excellent chef and he always orders the cheapest thing when his kids take him out to eat even though we tell him not to and we want him to order what he wants. I guess it is a dad thing. Anyway, I could tell he didn’t love it but that’s not to say it wasn’t delicious.  However, when my dad says “I can make this better” it’s not a good sign. I said “why didn’t you order something you can’t make” and his answer was “I can make everything” so I think you can see what we are dealing with here. 
My brother ordered the lamb shank and he shrugged and said “it’s good.” This is about all you are going to get out of my brother so I apologize for not elaborating but he’s a man of few words. Last time I ate at tutto my husband ordered the lamb shank and he said it was delicious, moist, melt in your mouth good. So there you go.
I got my favorite dish at any Italian restaurant which is the Fettuccine al Carbonara. Made with pancetta, egg, peas, parmigiana, onions, basil and olive oil. It was delicious! Perfect portion size so I didn’t have to unbutton my pants afterwards and the flavors were exactly as they should be. If I could make this myself I would, but every time I try it never tastes as good as when I eat it out so now it is my go to dish. Last time I was at Tutto I also got this dish and it was as good, if not better this time so I know they are consistent.
We ended up getting another bottle of the delicious cabernet and that was going to be our dessert but the general manager brought out cannoli’s for the table and a tiramisu for my dad. We were so impressed by their thoughtfulness and excellent service. I don’t even like tiramisu but I liked this one. It was delicious. 
Overall, this is a great spot for lunch or dinner, the service is excellent and the food is good. Consistent and tasty. Could they improve on some things with the food? Sure, but the service is amazing and the everyone is so nice and welcoming I would go back even if the food wasn’t good. Bottom line, great spot off the crowded and noisy hustle of Canton Street. I hope to see Tutto stick around for a long time!

data.title: Very good food and nice atmosphere
data.text: A small restaurant that is conveniently located in Roswell with very good food and great staff. I ate there twice in a week with friends, so there must have been 10 or more different entrees between everyone and they were all excellent. Good portions, great flavor, nice presentation and the price was reasonable. A nice pace for dinner - we had time to enjoy our drinks and meals, not rushed but never waiting for our waiter. Great way to spend an evening out for dinner!

data.title: "Mamma Mia!" Risottos
data.text: A local friend brought us to this wonderful restaurant for a jolly team dinner. The choice couldn't have been any better. The quality of food, reasonably priced decent wines list, friendly staff, and good ambience make Tutto an excellent choice.

data.title: Upscale Italian Restaurant
data.text: A group of 8 visited Tutto's on a Wednesday night.  Service could have been better though I am not sure if it was our waiter or the kitchen.  Food was very slow to come out.  I had the veal meatballs which I would highly recommend.  Other dishes our group enjoyed was the short rib rigatoni, and the lasagna which is layer upon layers of just cheese.  A bit pricey but again it is an upscale restaurant.

data.title: Ughh just wanted good service
data.text: Sat at the bar after a long day.  Bartender was so mean and slow but was kinda funny after the manager stepped in to help her.  Was slow and early in the night but they had no clean wine glasses? Then asked to taste wines were brought different wines and after we asked told they were out of them?? Octopus appetizer was amazing wish we could have tried more food but couldn't take the service

data.title: Very good Italian
data.text: Our extended family of six at at Tutto Saturday night. The pasta was freshly made, and was excellent. A bit on the pricey side, the food and service were very good. The asparagus and mushroom risotto was especially good. We will be back.

data.title: Love it here!
data.text: This was our second visit. Had a nice meal the first time about a year ago so wanted to try it again with different friends. Even better than the first time. Fun atmosphere. Great service. Grilled octopus appetizer was the best I've ever had....prepared perfectly!.Split a beet salad with my friend and it was delicious and plenty for both of us. I had the shrimp risotto which was so good. The caprese salad was beautiful! Could only eat half and took the other half home. Others had the seafood fra diablo...also yummy. And one person got the steak which he very much enjoyed. Definitely will return!!!!

data.title: Tutto is SoSo
data.text:
Had dinner here for the second time this week, and as much as I am pulling for this place to succeed, so far my meals have been average.  First visit was linguini with clam sauce.  The simplest of Italian cuisine, and I was disappointed with a creamy sauce, not the simple olive oil.  I give the chef credit for trying to pull off a twist on this classic Italian meal, but it just did not work for me.

My second meal was the Braised Colorado Veal Shank, which was covered with way too much sauce.
Both meals were edible, but nothing to run through the streets of Roswell, singing it's praises.

The staff is very friendly, and the bar well stocked, so with a little improvement in their meals,it could become quite an enjoyable joint to frequent.

data.title: Potential for nice Roswell restaurant
data.text: I've been to Tutto Kitchen & Bar several times with my husband and for a girl's night out and have enjoyed the food.  The Chicken Piccata and Seafood Fra Diavolo are very good and the portions are hearty. However, there is a waitress that is very unprofessional and should not be speaking with or waiting on customers.

data.title: Wonderful wine experience and fabulous ambience!
data.text: Love the feel of this place. The bar is friendly and lively. Stephan is a very helpful and well informed wine somiler that I learn more from each time we go! For much you must try the gourmet grill cheese sandwich w/ tomato basil soup. Goat cheese balls are an appetizer must!

data.title: TUTTO-2 good 2 miss
data.text:
Tutto has been open for a year but its location is off Canton Street so it is easy to miss.
My mother in law, who lives with us, visited there with her son and we went there yesterday based on her review. She accompanied my wife and I for a late lunch. The lunch is handled by the manager/greeter/waiter/ and busboy.  He is quite busy but the service was excellent.

My wife and mother-in-law both had the lasagna while I had the Scampi and one of the best tomato basil soups I have ever had. The scampi was very tasty and the lasagna was excellent according to my wife and mother-in-law.

Dessert was excellent as well.  I had the Chocolate Lava cake and my wife and mother-and mother in law had the canole. They thought this was the best they have ever tasted.

The prices are very reasonable and the 1930's music a welcome extra.

My mother in law and her other son are going for lunch today and we plan to visit there in the near future.
